page.title: 07Mayfair: 05280180
page.content: The main attraction in Mayfair is Bond Street which has many tourists making it quite a busy place. The majority of land is owned by the Duke of Westminster and the British Petroleum Pension Fund Trust. Houses, which are quite expensive, range from 200,000 to 2,500,000 pounds. There are three quite famous squares called Berkeley, Grosvenor and Hanover Squares and a market called Shepherd Market. Somewhere between two and three thousand people live in Mayfair permanently and there are several hotels; the most famous being Claridge's, the Hilton, The Connaught, the Dorchester and Grosvenor House. Mayfair also contains a lot of foreign embassies, the largest of them being the American Embassy, located in Grosvenor Square.
